Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
divs: sighting detailsmy friend and i took a drive and remarked how clear the skies were, noted venus (25 - 30 degrees up from the horizon.) venus was very bright (white) in the sky. this was approximately 6:30pm (central.) my friend and i witness two orange balls (one larger than the other) at 7:05pm (central.) these objects were moving. these objects appeared to be very near the monroe city area, we were in washington driving west. i quickly found venus which was evident and about to set, these orange balls were not venus. each orange ball quickly dissappeared (not at the same time.) we were travelling west on a country road and saw them reappear in a different location. one orange ball was larger and quickly disappeared. when it did disappear i noticed a twinkling at the location it disappeared. my friend and i noticed about 4 - 6 other twinkling objects (which were moving.) from then on we observed frequent (5 - 7 minutes) of orange balls appearing and disappearing at approximately 15 - 20 degrees up from the horizon. during this time you could see the same twinkling after (some) of the sightings. a drawing of the most common observation (two balls) is attached. over the next 3 - 5 minutes we observed a series of appear\disappear events with up to 3 orange balls, some very close to the ground (a 3 ball drawing is attached). i then notice an orange ball, low to the horizon, move straight up, sort of bob up and down then disappear. 2 or 3 minutes passed and we saw the large ball appear followed by 4 more in an semi-circle line and another ball appearing(6 at the same time.) drawing of this incident is attached. at this time we called jerry sievers (vincennes) of indiana mufon (approximatly 7:20pm central.) at approximately 7:25pm central we observed one more orange ball appear\disappear much further south (south of monroe city 3 miles) which was very low in the horizon. our last observation was one of the twinkling objects which passed directly over our heads (approximately 1000 feet) at 7:28pm central. we could not discern a sound and the object had one red light and a swirling strobe (swirling around in a circle). the strobe was very odd and we both commented how (un-airplane like) the strobe was. we could not clearly make out the shape of the object. the object was traveling north. we waited several minutes longer and did not see any more activity (7:45pm central.) we must have observed orange balls at least 18 - 20 times over the 25 minutes. sometimes the balls were stationary, some times they were moving. the largest gap in time between sightings was 4 - 5 minutes. one time a smaller orange ball seemed to be rotating around a larger orange ball before both disappeared. our conclusion was that we were witnessing a ufo incident. each time we observed a new orange ball we shouted "there it is, there's another one." we tried to reason away these objects as flares, meteors and airplanes. the orange balls varied in "orange" intensity. each observation was different from the previous observation in movement and location. we did not believe they were flares due to the multiple locations (across the horizon) which we viewed these objects and the twinkling after some of the post-disappearance observations. there were no trailing tails as seen with meteors. the low altitude made us certain these were not airplanes especially when the 6 orange ball event (at the same time) happened.
Summary: Multiple orange balls witnessed that dissappeared and reappeared over 25 minutes
trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Washington
There were no other sightings in Washington on or around February 8th 2007
This sighting has never been favorited.
